intro: Malacothamnus enigmaticus, commonly known as the enigmatic thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include narrow, glandular leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
